text: The Untouchables is a 1987 American crime movie directed by Brian De Palma, produced by Art Linson, written by David Mamet, and based on the book of the same name (1957). ==Background== It is about Eliot Ness (Costner) as he creates the Untouchables team to bring Al Capone (De Niro) to justice during Prohibition. The Grammy Award–nominated score was composed by Ennio Morricone. ==Cast== *Kevin Costner as Eliot Ness *Charles Martin Smith as Oscar Wallace *Andy García as George Stone/Giuseppe Petri *Robert De Niro as Al Capone *Sean Connery as Jimmy Malone *Patricia Clarkson as Catherine Ness *Billy Drago as Frank Nitti *Richard Bradford as Chief Mike Dorsett *Jack Kehoe as Walter Payne *Brad Sullivan as George *Del Close as Alderman *Vito D'Ambrosio as Bowtie Driver *Clifton James as District Attorney George E. Q. Johnson (uncredited) *Don Patrick Harvey as Officer Preseuski ==Release== The Untouchables was released on June 3, 1987 in the United States. The movie made $106.2 million worldwide and had strong positive reviews from critics. It was nominated for four Academy Awards; Connery won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * * * Category:1987 crime movies Category:Movies composed by Ennio Morricone Category:Movies directed by Brian De Palma Category:American crime movies Category:Movies based on books Category:English-language movies Category:Paramount Pictures movies Category:Movies set in Chicago Category:Movies based on autobiographies Category:1980s English-language movies Category:Movies featuring a Best Supporting Actor Academy Award-winning performance
